Class GameFiles

java.lang.Object
MyGame.GameFiles
public final class GameFiles extends Object
Utility class for game-related file operations.

See MyGame for how the files are structured and used.

    • write

      public static void write(Path filePath, Object content)
      Writes to a file. Creates the file if it doesn't exist. Creates the parent directories if they don't exist.
      Parameters:
      filePath - the path to the file
      content - the content to write to the file
      Throws:
      RuntimeException - if the file can't be written

    • create

      public static void create(Path filePath)
      Creates a file. Creates the parent directories if they don't exist.
      Parameters:
      filePath - the path to the file

    • read

      public static String read(Path filePath)
      Reads a file. Returns null if for any reason the file can't be read.
      Parameters:
      filePath - the path to the file
      Returns:
      the content of the file

    • removeRecursive

      public static void removeRecursive(Path filePath)
      rm -rf a path. Silently ignores all errors.
      Parameters:
      filePath - the path to rm -rf

    • emptyDirRecursive

      public static void emptyDirRecursive(Path dirPath)
      Recursively removes all files in a directory, but not the directory itself. Silently ignores all errors.
      Parameters:
      dirPath - the path to the directory

    • listDir

      public static List<Path> listDir(Path dirPath)
      Lists all files in a directory. Returns an empty list if for any reason the operation fails.
      Parameters:
      dirPath - the path to the directory
      Returns:
      a list of all files in the directory
